definition: a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]

sentences.chinese: 對古代碑銘文字的研究。

sentences.english: According to the inscription on its cornerstone, this building was erected in 1919。
sentences.chinese: 根據基石上的碑銘，這棟建築物建於1919年。

sentences.english: The inscriptions on the ancient monuments have been effaced by time.
sentences.chinese: 歲月抹去了古碑上的碑銘。

sentences.english: The inscriptions on the ancient monuments have been effaced by time.
sentences.chinese: 這個古建築上的碑銘隨着時間的推移被抹去。

sentences.english: After he had made his selection , the stonecutter asked him what inscription he would like on it.
sentences.chinese: 他選好了以後，石匠問他，要在墓碑上刻什麼碑銘。

sentences.english: He read the inscription before the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 對古代碑銘文字的研究。

sentences.english: This inscription was written by Yan Zhenqing, the great calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 這個碑銘出自唐代大書法家顏真卿的手筆。

sentences.english: This stone tablet was from Wu, which was established by Yang Hsin Mi in the period of Five-Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 本碑銘，是我國五代時期，楊行密所創建的吳國之物。

definition: notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
Nêdong county, Tibetan: Sne gdong rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
booklet/brochure/(old) book (made of bamboo strips tied together)
to restore old way/to return to the past
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
Jintai District of Baoji City 寶雞市|宝鸡市[Bao3 ji1 Shi4], Shaanxi
